contributionAmount.description: Describes the amount that the client can contribute.Should be a numeric value between -999,999,99.99 and 999,999,999.99.

expectedReturn.description: Captures the clients expected return in percent.

initialGoalAmount.description: Describes the amount the client has to invest.Should be a numeric value >= 0 and up to a maximum value of 999,999,999,999.99.

nPeriods.description: Captures the investment time horizon , in Year.

nTrials.description: Number of trials.Default value defines in appl_parameter of Front Office  PM PCK_GL_MCS_TRIALS_DEFAULT.

targetGoalAmount.description: Describes the amount that will be needed at the end of the goal.Should be a numeric value >= 0 and up to a maximum value of 999,999,999,999.99.

volatility.description: Captures the clients risk tolerance.Should be a percentage value >= 0 and <= 100.

year.description: Year of each period; always begin today.

eventCode.description:
Indicates the reference of the standing instruction related to a financial plan investment.

Once the event generation function is run on a financial plan, it creates the necessary plan investment dates, corresponding to the different investments to do based on the characteristics of the plan and its standing instruction. Each of these plan investment date will have its event code set as the standing instruction used to generate the orders.

Note that should the Mutual Fund Systematic plan have more than one standing instruction, the first one is used to set the event code.

eventNumberN.description:
Indicates the date related to a financial plan investment.

Once the event generation function is run on a financial plan, it creates the necessary plan investment dates, corresponding to the different investments to do based on the characteristics of the plan and its standing instruction. Each of these plan investment date will have its event number set as investment plan date, with the format YYYYMMDD, for example 20190201 a for a plan investment date on February 1st 2019.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

investmentD.description: Provides the date of the investment.

planInvestParamHistoId.description: Identifies the Plan Investment Parameter History related to the plan investment date.

retryN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the retry number related to a plan investment.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed. 

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

statusE.description: Provides the status of the investment.

creationD.description: Provides the creation date of the record.

beginD.description: Provides the begin date of the plan investment parameter.

counterpartAccountC.description: Account where the recurrent deposit must be transferred from. This attribute is not a link to the instrument entity in order to support accounts not present in FOPM but available in the back-office.

creationD.description: Provides the creation date of the plan investment parameter.

endOfMonthConvE.description: Provides the ability to manage the real last day of the month (i.e., 30th or 31st depending on the month).

firstInvestD.description: Provides the first investment date defined for the financial plan.

genCashOpF.description: Manages the ability to specify whether the cash transfer operation from the debited account has to be created.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

investAcctCode.description: Identifies the account where the cash is reserved and the one where the security investment will be settled.

investFreqN.description: Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan investment parameter that are used to specify the date of investment.

investFreqUnitE.description: Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan investment parameter that are used to specify the date of investment.

investmentDayE.description: Provides the day in a month on which the investment is done.

lastInvestmentD.description: Provides the last investment date defined for the financial plan. This date is set by default value and used only for information purposes, no processes are linked to this date.

maxInvestAmtM.description: Provides the maximum amount to invest. It manages the ability to cap the amount to invest mainly when, for instance, there are missing payments or the objective amount has been updated.

maxRetryN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the maximum number of order retries before an order cycle is skipped.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

nextInvestD.description: Provides the next investment date calculated for the financial plan.

orderCyclesN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the number of cycles required for the plan. This number is then used to calculate, by default value, the plan end date.

Lets take the following example: a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan starts on February 14th 2018, with a monthly frequency, investing every 20th of each month.

The first investment date will be defaulted as February 20th 2018.

Should the user enters the number of cycles as 12 (meaning investing for 12 months), the end date will be defaulted as January 20th 2019.

The 12 investment dates would be:
1 - 20.02.2018
2 - 20.03.2018
3 - 20.04.2018
4 - 20.05.2018
5 - 20.06.2018
6 - 20.07.2018
7 - 20.08.2018
8 - 20.09.2018
9 - 20.10.2018
10 - 20.11.2018
11 - 20.12.2018
12 - 20.01.2019

planDefinitionCode.description: Identifies the plan definition related to the plan investment parameter.

retryFrequencyN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the frequency number for each order retry.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

The retry frequency number must be used in conjunction with the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e).

For example, should you want to set up a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry of failed orders each 2 days, the frequency number (retry_frequency_n) must set to 2, and the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e) to 1 (day).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

retryFrequencyUnitE.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the frequency unit for each order retry.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

The retry frequency unit must be used in conjunction with the retry frequency number (retry_frequency_n).

For example, should you want to set up a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry of failed orders each 2 days, the frequency number (retry_frequency_n) must set to 2, and the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e) to 1 (day).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

This attribute is used to track the standing order saved in the external tool that manages all the cash transfers.

transferFromAcctCode.description: Identifies the cash account that is debited for the investment.

transferFromPortfolioCode.description: Identifies the portfolio of the cash account that is debited for the investment.

updAmtToCashE.description: Provides the amount that can be updated depending on the available cash in the linked account.

updAmtToObjectiveE.description:
Provides the amount of the investment that can be updated to reach the minimum or the maximum amount defined at the plan objective level or the plan rule level.

For plan with objective nature set to "Free Amount", "Period Amount", or "Objective Amount", Update Amount to Objective should be set to No.

For plan with objective nature set to  "Invest Amount",  Update Amount to Objective should be set to No or Reach min.

calcFromD.description:
Specifies the starting date in financial functions that return financial data calculated between two dates (Journal, Operation History, Performance and Return).
For single date functions (Valuation, Strategy Check) enter the date for which you want the function to run.
Valuation function does not retrieve prices in the future even if the entered date is greater than the current date.

calcTillD.description: The date used as the end date in financial functions that return financial data calculated between two dates. The financial functions in question are Journal, Operation History, Performance and Return.

funcResultCode.description: Optional parameter that lets you specify the reference code of a result set when you want to store/use computed data.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity. 

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

planDefinitionCode.description:
Indicates the plan to use in conjunction with the Generation Nature "Create Session & Check" (event_gen_nat_e = 10 - Create Session & Check).

This allows launching an event generation function in a simulation mode with a working Mutual Fund Systematic plan definition set as parameter. The goal is to simulate the generation of the first order cycle of a specific plan, and only for this plan.

The result of the event generation simulation mode, meaning a set of buy orders, are included in a session on which a PTCC is run, with potential cases raised.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about plan simulation.

Note that the plan definition field is not displayed in the default domain GUI screen; the reason being that it is currently only used in the WealthSuite Channels for Mutual Fund Systematic Plan module.

portfolioCode.description:
This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

Portfolio set in the domain context when the portfolio dimension is a single portfolio.

beginD.description:
Provides the begin date of a standing instruction. This date is part of the standing instruction primary key.

This information is combined with the 'end date' to define the validity period of the standing instruction. It also defines the date of the future generated orders:
- The first generated order will be on exactly this date.
- The date of the following orders will be calculated from this date.

Examples:
begin date = "15/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Day" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 15/04/2009, 16/04/2009, 17/04/2009, ....

begin date = "15/01/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 3
=> dates of generation, 15/01/2009, 15/04/2009, 15/07/2009, ....

begin date = "30/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 30/04/2009, 31/05/2009, 30/06/2009, ....
In this case, a begin date equal to an end of month associated with a frequency unit "Month" leads only to dates equal at end of month.

code.description: Provides the unique business identifier of the Standing Instruction and is displayed to the end user. This field is mandatory.

commentC.description: Optional text field that can store user comments.

dayFriF.description:
Specifies whether "Friday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayMonF.description:
Specifies whether "Monday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

daySatF.description:
Specifies whether "Saturday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

daySunF.description:
Specifies whether "Sunday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayThuF.description:
Specifies whether "Thursday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayTueF.description:
Specifies whether "Tuesday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayWedF.description:
Specifies whether "Wednesday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

denom.description: Provides the denomination of the standing instruction; the denomination might not necessarily be unique. This field is optional.

endD.description:
Provides the end date of a standing instruction. This parameter is optional.

This information is combined with the 'begin date' to define the validity period of the standing instruction. No end date provided means no end to the standing instruction.

executionDayN.description:
Specifies the day of the month when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Specific Day".

executionMonthN.description:
Specifies the month when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency unit "Year".

executionUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit of execution for calculating the date when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Calculated Day".

executionUnitRankE.description:
Specifies the rank of unit execution for calculating the date when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Calculated Day".

freqN.description:
Specifies the frequency with which the order is generated and defines the number of standing instruction frequency units (see attribute freq_unit_e ) between two occurrences.
This is a mandatory field.

Examples:
begin date = "15/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Day" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 15/04/2009, 16/04/2009, 17/04/2009, ....

begin date = "15/01/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 3
=> dates of generation, 15/01/2009, 15/04/2009, 15/07/2009, ....

begin date = "30/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 30/04/2009, 31/05/2009, 30/06/2009, ....
In this case, a begin date equal to an end of month associated with a frequency unit "Month" leads only to dates equal at end of month.

freqUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit that defines the frequency with which the order is generated. This field is mandatory.

Only the following frequencies are supported:
- Day
- Month
- Year

frequencyChoiceE.description:
Defines the frequency choice.

This choice depends on the frequency unit:

For unit "Days"
- 1 = every days
- 2 = every weekday

For unit "Month"
- 1 = specific day
- 2 = calculated day

For unit "Year"
- 1 = specific day
- 2 = calculated day

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

instrCode.description: Reference to the instrument that will be present in the generated order. Any nature of instrument can be referenced. This field is mandatory.

instrDenom.description: Reference to the instrument that will be present in the generated order. Any nature of instrument can be referenced. This field is mandatory.

lastEventGenerateD.description: Provides the date of the last order generation of the occurrence by the Event Generation function.

minInvestAmtM.description:
The minimum amount to be invested for the current instruction in the context of a financial planning.

If the calculated amount to invest is greater than or equal to this minimum amount to invest, the system creates an operation using the calculated amount to invest.

name.description: Provides the name of the standing instruction; the name might not necessarily be unique. This field is optional.

opAmountCurrencyCode.description:
Specifies the currency of the amount of this occurrence.

IMPORTANT: this currency will also be the Operation Currency of the generated order.

This field is mandatory.

opAmountM.description: Indicates the maximum amount of the generated orders. This field is mandatory.

opNatE.description: Reference to the nature of operation that will be present in the generated order. This field is mandatory.

orderFeeAmtM.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee amount when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 1 (In Amount).

This amount must be used in conjunction with the fee amount currency (order_fee_curr_id).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeCurrCode.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the currency of the negotiated fee amount when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 1 (In Amount).

This currency must be used in conjunction with the fee amount (order_fee_amt_m).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeE.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee set-up.

The set-up can be either 0 (Not negotiated), 1 (Negotiated in amount) or 2 (Negotiated in percent).

When the set-up is 1 (Negotiated in amount), then the fields order fee amount (order_fee_amt_m) and currency (order_fee_curr_id) must be defined.

When the set-up is 2 (Negotiated in percent), then the field order fee percent(order_fee_p) must be defined.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeP.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee percent when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 2 (In Percent).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

paymentOptionE.description: Indicates the decision of the investor, if  the Fund dividends should be paid out in cash, or re-invested into the fund

planDefinitionCode.description: Identifies the plan definition linked to the standing instruction.

portfolioCode.description: Reference to the portfolio of the standing instruction.

statusE.description:
Provides the status of the standing instruction and distinguishes between the various stages of the processing of a standing instruction. This field is mandatory.

Business functions take into account only standing instructions from a special stage.
This stage is defined by system parameter STANDING_INSTRUCTION_STAT_EXEC.

weightP.description: Provides the weight of the standing instruction.

code.description: Provides the unique business identifier of the Standing Instruction and is displayed to the end user. This field is mandatory.

commentC.description: Optional text field that can store user comments.

dayFriF.description:
Specifies whether "Friday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayMonF.description:
Specifies whether "Monday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

daySatF.description:
Specifies whether "Saturday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

daySunF.description:
Specifies whether "Sunday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayThuF.description:
Specifies whether "Thursday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayTueF.description:
Specifies whether "Tuesday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayWedF.description:
Specifies whether "Wednesday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

denom.description: Provides the denomination of the standing instruction; the denomination might not necessarily be unique. This field is optional.

endD.description:
Provides the end date of a standing instruction. This parameter is optional.

This information is combined with the 'begin date' to define the validity period of the standing instruction. No end date provided means no end to the standing instruction.

executionDayN.description:
Specifies the day of the month when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Specific Day".

executionMonthN.description:
Specifies the month when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency unit "Year".

executionUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit of execution for calculating the date when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Calculated Day".

executionUnitRankE.description:
Specifies the rank of unit execution for calculating the date when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Calculated Day".

freqN.description:
Specifies the frequency with which the order is generated and defines the number of standing instruction frequency units (see attribute freq_unit_e ) between two occurrences.
This is a mandatory field.

Examples:
begin date = "15/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Day" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 15/04/2009, 16/04/2009, 17/04/2009, ....

begin date = "15/01/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 3
=> dates of generation, 15/01/2009, 15/04/2009, 15/07/2009, ....

begin date = "30/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 30/04/2009, 31/05/2009, 30/06/2009, ....
In this case, a begin date equal to an end of month associated with a frequency unit "Month" leads only to dates equal at end of month.

freqUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit that defines the frequency with which the order is generated. This field is mandatory.

Only the following frequencies are supported:
- Day
- Month
- Year

frequencyChoiceE.description:
Defines the frequency choice.

This choice depends on the frequency unit:

For unit "Days"
- 1 = every days
- 2 = every weekday

For unit "Month"
- 1 = specific day
- 2 = calculated day

For unit "Year"
- 1 = specific day
- 2 = calculated day

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

instrCode.description: Reference to the instrument that will be present in the generated order. Any nature of instrument can be referenced. This field is mandatory.

instrDenom.description: Reference to the instrument that will be present in the generated order. Any nature of instrument can be referenced. This field is mandatory.

lastEventGenerateD.description: Provides the date of the last order generation of the occurrence by the Event Generation function.

minInvestAmtM.description:
The minimum amount to be invested for the current instruction in the context of a financial planning.

If the calculated amount to invest is greater than or equal to this minimum amount to invest, the system creates an operation using the calculated amount to invest.

name.description: Provides the name of the standing instruction; the name might not necessarily be unique. This field is optional.

opAmountCurrencyCode.description:
Specifies the currency of the amount of this occurrence.

IMPORTANT: this currency will also be the Operation Currency of the generated order.

This field is mandatory.

opAmountM.description: Indicates the maximum amount of the generated orders. This field is mandatory.

opNatE.description: Reference to the nature of operation that will be present in the generated order. This field is mandatory.

orderFeeAmtM.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee amount when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 1 (In Amount).

This amount must be used in conjunction with the fee amount currency (order_fee_curr_id).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeCurrCode.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the currency of the negotiated fee amount when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 1 (In Amount).

This currency must be used in conjunction with the fee amount (order_fee_amt_m).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeE.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee set-up.

The set-up can be either 0 (Not negotiated), 1 (Negotiated in amount) or 2 (Negotiated in percent).

When the set-up is 1 (Negotiated in amount), then the fields order fee amount (order_fee_amt_m) and currency (order_fee_curr_id) must be defined.

When the set-up is 2 (Negotiated in percent), then the field order fee percent(order_fee_p) must be defined.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeP.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee percent when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 2 (In Percent).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

paymentOptionE.description: Indicates the decision of the investor, if  the Fund dividends should be paid out in cash, or re-invested into the fund

planDefinitionCode.description: Identifies the plan definition linked to the standing instruction.

portfolioCode.description: Reference to the portfolio of the standing instruction.

statusE.description:
Provides the status of the standing instruction and distinguishes between the various stages of the processing of a standing instruction. This field is mandatory.

Business functions take into account only standing instructions from a special stage.
This stage is defined by system parameter STANDING_INSTRUCTION_STAT_EXEC.

weightP.description: Provides the weight of the standing instruction.

assetClassCode.description: Aggregates all positions of instruments belonging to the asset class according to the instrument classification defined in the system parameter DS_CLASSIF_ASSET_CLASS.

assetclassCostSys.description: Indicates the asset class cost amount in system currency.

assetclassKey.description: Indicates the break criteria per portfolio/asset class.

assetclassMvPtf.description: Indicates the market value of the asset class in the system currency.

assetclassMvSys.description: Indicates the market value of the asset class in the system currency.

assetclassPlPer.description: Indicates the PL in percentage of the asset class.

assetclassPlPtf.description: Indicates the PL of the asset class in the portfolio currency.

assetclassPlSys.description: Indicates the PL of the asset class in the system currency.

assetclassWeight.description: Indicates the weight of the asset class relative to the portfolio market value.

ccyClassCode.description: Aggregates all positions of instruments belonging to the currency class according to the currency classification defined in system parameter DS_CLASSIF_CURRENCY.

ccyclassCostSys.description: Indicates the currency class cost amount in the system currency.

ccyclassKey.description: Indicates the break criteria per portfolio/currency class.

ccyclassMvPtf.description: Indicates the market value of the currency in the portfolio currency.

ccyclassMvSys.description: Indicates the market value of the currency in the system currency.

ccyclassPlPer.description: Indicates the PL in percentage of the currency.

ccyclassPlPtf.description: Indicates the PL of the currency class PL in the portfolio currency.

ccyclassPlSys.description: Indicates the PL of the currency in the system currency.

ccyclassWeight.description: Indicates the weight of the currency relative to the portfolio market value.

costAmountSys.description: Indicates the cost amount in the system currency.

exchRateRefPtf.description: Indicates the exchange rate between Reference and Portfolio currency.

exchRateRefSys.description: Exchange rate between Reference and System currency.

exchRateSysPtf.description: Exchange rate between System and Portfolio currency.

portfolioCcyCode.description: Reference to the currency of the portfolio.

portfolioCode.description: Portfolio to which the request is related.

ratingClassCode.description: Aggregates all positions of instruments belonging to the rating class according to both the instrument classification defined in the system parameter DS_CLASSIF_RATING and the list of instrument defined in system parameter DS_VALO_FILTER_RATING.

ratingclassCostSys.description: Rating class cost amount in system currency.

ratingclassMvPtf.description: Market value of the rating in the portfolio currency.

ratingclassMvSys.description: Market value of the rating in the system currency.

ratingclassPlPer.description: PL in percentage of the rating.

ratingclassPlPtf.description: Rating class PL in portfolio currency.

ratingclassPlSys.description: PL of the rating in the system currency.

ratingclassWeight.description: Weight of the rating relative to the portfolio market value.

sectorClassCode.description: Aggregates all positions of instruments belonging to both the rating class according to the instrument classification defined in the system parameter DS_CLASSIF_SECTOR and the list of instrument defined in the system parameter DS_VALO_FILTER_SECTOR.

sectorclassCostSys.description: Sector class cost amount in system currency.

sectorclassMvPtf.description: Market value of the sector in the portfolio currency.

sectorclassMvSys.description: Market value of the sector in the system currency.

sectorclassPlPer.description: PL in percentage of the sector.

sectorclassPlPtf.description: Sector class PL in portfolio currency.

sectorclassPlSys.description: PL of the sector in the system currency.

sectorclassWeight.description: Weight of the sector relative to the portfolio market value.

assetclassCode.description: Indicates the asset class of the instrument in the position. It is defined according to the instrument classification set in the system parameter DS_CLASSIF_ASSET_CLASS.

delta.description: Indicates the delta of the instrument in the position; applicable to options.

depositCode.description: Indicates the deposit set in the position.

duration.description: Indicates the duration of the instrument in the position.

durationFilter.description: Indicates the duration filter for record loaded.

exchRateCurr.description: Displays the exchange rate currency and underlying currency between the quotation currency of the instrument held in the Portfolio and the reference currency at the selected reference date.

exchRateRefPtf.description: Indicates the exchange rate between Reference and Portfolio currency.

exchRateRefSys.description: Indicates the exchange rate between Reference and System currency.

expiration.description: Indicates the expiration of the instrument in the position; applicable to instruments that have an expiration date.

instrCode.description: Indicates the instrument of the position.

instrRefCurrency.description: Indicates the currency of the instrument in the position.

instrTypeCode.description: Indicates the type of instrument in the position.

instrumentNature.description: Indicates the nature of the instrument in the position.

isin.description: Indicates the ISIN of the instrument.

maturityFilter.description: Indicates the maturity filter for record loaded.

mktVal.description: Indicates the market value of the position in the reference currency.

mktValPtf.description: Indicates the market value of the position in the portfolio currency.

mktValSys.description: Indicates the market value of the position in the system currency.

modifiedDuration.description: Indicates the modified duration of the instrument in the position.

netCostVal.description: Indicates the net cost value of the position in the reference currency.

netCostValPtf.description: Indicates the net cost value of the position in the portfolio currency.

netCostValSys.description: Indicates the net cost value of the position in the system currency.

percTotMktVal.description: Indicates the percentage relative to the total market value.

pl.description: Indicates the PL of the position in the reference currency.

plPrec.description: Indicates the PL of the position in percentage.

plPtfCur.description: Indicates the PL of the position in the portfolio currency.

plSysCur.description: Indicates the PL of the position in the system currency.

portfolioCode.description: Portfolio to which the request is related.

posCurrency.description: Indicates the currency of the position.

quantity.description: Indicates the quantity of the position.

ratingCode.description: Indicates the rating class of the instrument in the position. It is defined according to the instrument classification set in the system parameter DS_CLASSIF_RATING.

sectorCode.description: Indicates the sector class of the instrument in the position. It is defined similar according to the instrument classification set in the system parameter DS_CLASSIF_SECTOR.

underlyingCode.description: Indicates the underlying of the instrument in the position.

ytm.description: Indicates the yield to maturity of the instrument in the position.

code.description: Code of the Free Deposit History.

counterpartAccountC.description: Account where the free deposit must be transferred to. This attribute is not a link to the instrument entity in order to support account not present in FOPM but available in the back-office.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

planDefinitionCode.description: Definition of plan related to the deposit.

transferFromAcctCode.description: Cash account that is debited for the deposit.

transferFromPortfolioCode.description: Portfolio of the cash account that is debited for the deposit.

updAmtToCashE.description: Amount that can be updated depending on the available cash in the linked account.

dataSecuProfId.description: Provides a reference to the security profile to which the occurrence belongs. This mandatory reference controls user access to the occurrence.

denom.description: Provides the denomination of the Plan Definition.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

name.description: Provides the name of the Plan Definition.

natureE.description: Provides the nature of the Plan Definition.

objectiveNatureE.description: Provides the nature of the objective of the plan.

portfolioCode.description: Identifies the portfolio that is linked to the Plan Definition. A portfolio can have only one valid plan at a time.

statusE.description: Provides the status of the Plan Definition.

thirdPartyCode.description: Identifies the client for which the financial plan is created.

validationD.description: Provides the date of validation for the Plan Definition.

creationD.description: Provides the creation date of the record.

eventCode.description:
Indicates the reference of the standing instruction related to a financial plan investment.

Once the event generation function is run on a financial plan, it creates the necessary plan investment dates, corresponding to the different investments to do based on the characteristics of the plan and its standing instruction. Each of these plan investment date will have its event code set as the standing instruction used to generate the orders.

Note that should the Mutual Fund Systematic plan have more than one standing instruction, the first one is used to set the event code.

eventNumberN.description:
Indicates the date related to a financial plan investment.

Once the event generation function is run on a financial plan, it creates the necessary plan investment dates, corresponding to the different investments to do based on the characteristics of the plan and its standing instruction. Each of these plan investment date will have its event number set as investment plan date, with the format YYYYMMDD, for example 20190201 a for a plan investment date on February 1st 2019.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

investmentD.description: Provides the date of the investment.

planInvestParamHistoId.description: Identifies the Plan Investment Parameter History related to the plan investment date.

retryN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the retry number related to a plan investment.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed. 

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

statusE.description: Provides the status of the investment.

beginD.description: Provides the begin date of the plan investment parameter.

counterpartAccountC.description: Account where the recurrent deposit must be transferred from. This attribute is not a link to the instrument entity in order to support accounts not present in FOPM but available in the back-office.

creationD.description: Provides the creation date of the plan investment parameter.

endOfMonthConvE.description: Provides the ability to manage the real last day of the month (i.e., 30th or 31st depending on the month).

firstInvestD.description: Provides the first investment date defined for the financial plan.

genCashOpF.description: Manages the ability to specify whether the cash transfer operation from the debited account has to be created.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

investAcctCode.description: Identifies the account where the cash is reserved and the one where the security investment will be settled.

investFreqN.description: Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan investment parameter that are used to specify the date of investment.

investFreqUnitE.description: Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan investment parameter that are used to specify the date of investment.

investmentDayE.description: Provides the day in a month on which the investment is done.

lastInvestmentD.description: Provides the last investment date defined for the financial plan. This date is set by default value and used only for information purposes, no processes are linked to this date.

maxInvestAmtM.description: Provides the maximum amount to invest. It manages the ability to cap the amount to invest mainly when, for instance, there are missing payments or the objective amount has been updated.

maxRetryN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the maximum number of order retries before an order cycle is skipped.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

nextInvestD.description: Provides the next investment date calculated for the financial plan.

orderCyclesN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the number of cycles required for the plan. This number is then used to calculate, by default value, the plan end date.

Lets take the following example: a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan starts on February 14th 2018, with a monthly frequency, investing every 20th of each month.

The first investment date will be defaulted as February 20th 2018.

Should the user enters the number of cycles as 12 (meaning investing for 12 months), the end date will be defaulted as January 20th 2019.

The 12 investment dates would be:
1 - 20.02.2018
2 - 20.03.2018
3 - 20.04.2018
4 - 20.05.2018
5 - 20.06.2018
6 - 20.07.2018
7 - 20.08.2018
8 - 20.09.2018
9 - 20.10.2018
10 - 20.11.2018
11 - 20.12.2018
12 - 20.01.2019

planDefinitionCode.description: Identifies the plan definition related to the plan investment parameter.

retryFrequencyN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the frequency number for each order retry.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

The retry frequency number must be used in conjunction with the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e).

For example, should you want to set up a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry of failed orders each 2 days, the frequency number (retry_frequency_n) must set to 2, and the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e) to 1 (day).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

retryFrequencyUnitE.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the frequency unit for each order retry.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

The retry frequency unit must be used in conjunction with the retry frequency number (retry_frequency_n).

For example, should you want to set up a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry of failed orders each 2 days, the frequency number (retry_frequency_n) must set to 2, and the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e) to 1 (day).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

standingOrderExternalRef.description:
Provides the external reference to the standing order.
This attribute is used to track the standing order saved in the external tool that manages all the cash transfers.

transferFromAcctCode.description: Identifies the cash account that is debited for the investment.

transferFromPortfolioCode.description: Identifies the portfolio of the cash account that is debited for the investment.

updAmtToCashE.description: Provides the amount that can be updated depending on the available cash in the linked account.

updAmtToObjectiveE.description:
Provides the amount of the investment that can be updated to reach the minimum or the maximum amount defined at the plan objective level or the plan rule level.

For plan with objective nature set to "Free Amount", "Period Amount", or "Objective Amount", Update Amount to Objective should be set to No.

For plan with objective nature set to  "Invest Amount",  Update Amount to Objective should be set to No or Reach min.

amountNatureE.description: Provides the nature of the amounts defined for the plan objective.

beginD.description: Provides the begin date of the plan objective.

creationD.description: Provides the creation date of the plan objective.

currencyCode.description: Identifies the currency of the amounts of the plan objective.

expectedAmountM.description: Provides the expected amount the user wants to achieve at the end of the plan. This amount is used only for information and is never used by the Event Generation function to compute the amount to invest.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

maxAmountM.description:
Provides the maximum amount to achieve for the plan objective.

For plan with objective nature set to "Amount Objective", the maximum amount is not necessary.

maxAmtIndexRuleE.description: Provides the indexation rule of the maximum amount.

maxAmtIndexValueN.description: Provides the indexation value of the maximum amount.

minAmountM.description:
Provides the minimum amount to achieve for the plan objective.

For plan with objective nature set to "Invest Amount", the minimum amount is mandatory and must be defined  either in the plan objective or in the plan rule.

For plan with objective nature set to "Free Amount", the maximum amount is not necessary.

minAmtIndexRuleE.description: Provides the indexation rule of the minimum amount.

minAmtIndexValueN.description: Provides the indexation value of the minimum amount.

objectiveD.description: Provides the end date of the plan objective.

periodFreqN.description: Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan objective that are used to specify the time-lapse to achieve the goal.

periodFreqUnitE.description:
Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan objective that are used to specify the time-lapse to achieve the goal.

For plan with objective nature set to "Period Amount", the period frequency is mandatory and must be defined either in the plan objective or in the plan rule.

For plan with objective nature set to "Invest Amount" or "Free Amount", the period frequency is not necessary.

planDefinitionCode.description: Identifies the plan definition related to the plan objective.

calcFromD.description:
Specifies the starting date in financial functions that return financial data calculated between two dates (Journal, Operation History, Performance and Return).
For single date functions (Valuation, Strategy Check) enter the date for which you want the function to run.
Valuation function does not retrieve prices in the future even if the entered date is greater than the current date.

calcTillD.description: The date used as the end date in financial functions that return financial data calculated between two dates. The financial functions in question are Journal, Operation History, Performance and Return.

funcResultCode.description: Optional parameter that lets you specify the reference code of a result set when you want to store/use computed data.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity. 

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

planDefinitionCode.description:
Indicates the plan to use in conjunction with the Generation Nature "Create Session & Check" (event_gen_nat_e = 10 - Create Session & Check).

This allows launching an event generation function in a simulation mode with a working Mutual Fund Systematic plan definition set as parameter. The goal is to simulate the generation of the first order cycle of a specific plan, and only for this plan.

The result of the event generation simulation mode, meaning a set of buy orders, are included in a session on which a PTCC is run, with potential cases raised.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about plan simulation.

Note that the plan definition field is not displayed in the default domain GUI screen; the reason being that it is currently only used in the WealthSuite Channels for Mutual Fund Systematic Plan module.

portfolioCode.description:
This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

Portfolio set in the domain context when the portfolio dimension is a single portfolio.

beginD.description:
Provides the begin date of a standing instruction. This date is part of the standing instruction primary key.

This information is combined with the 'end date' to define the validity period of the standing instruction. It also defines the date of the future generated orders:
- The first generated order will be on exactly this date.
- The date of the following orders will be calculated from this date.

Examples:
begin date = "15/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Day" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 15/04/2009, 16/04/2009, 17/04/2009, ....

begin date = "15/01/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 3
=> dates of generation, 15/01/2009, 15/04/2009, 15/07/2009, ....

begin date = "30/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 30/04/2009, 31/05/2009, 30/06/2009, ....
In this case, a begin date equal to an end of month associated with a frequency unit "Month" leads only to dates equal at end of month.

code.description: Provides the unique business identifier of the Standing Instruction and is displayed to the end user. This field is mandatory.

commentC.description: Optional text field that can store user comments.

dayFriF.description:
Specifies whether "Friday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayMonF.description:
Specifies whether "Monday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

daySatF.description:
Specifies whether "Saturday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

daySunF.description:
Specifies whether "Sunday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayThuF.description:
Specifies whether "Thursday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayTueF.description:
Specifies whether "Tuesday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayWedF.description:
Specifies whether "Wednesday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

denom.description: Provides the denomination of the standing instruction; the denomination might not necessarily be unique. This field is optional.

endD.description:
Provides the end date of a standing instruction. This parameter is optional.

This information is combined with the 'begin date' to define the validity period of the standing instruction. No end date provided means no end to the standing instruction.

executionDayN.description:
Specifies the day of the month when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Specific Day".

executionMonthN.description:
Specifies the month when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency unit "Year".

executionUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit of execution for calculating the date when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Calculated Day".

executionUnitRankE.description:
Specifies the rank of unit execution for calculating the date when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Calculated Day".

freqN.description:
Specifies the frequency with which the order is generated and defines the number of standing instruction frequency units (see attribute freq_unit_e ) between two occurrences.
This is a mandatory field.

Examples:
begin date = "15/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Day" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 15/04/2009, 16/04/2009, 17/04/2009, ....

begin date = "15/01/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 3
=> dates of generation, 15/01/2009, 15/04/2009, 15/07/2009, ....

begin date = "30/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 30/04/2009, 31/05/2009, 30/06/2009, ....
In this case, a begin date equal to an end of month associated with a frequency unit "Month" leads only to dates equal at end of month.

freqUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit that defines the frequency with which the order is generated. This field is mandatory.

Only the following frequencies are supported:
- Day
- Month
- Year

frequencyChoiceE.description:
Defines the frequency choice.

This choice depends on the frequency unit:

For unit "Days"
- 1 = every days
- 2 = every weekday

For unit "Month"
- 1 = specific day
- 2 = calculated day

For unit "Year"
- 1 = specific day
- 2 = calculated day

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

instrCode.description: Reference to the instrument that will be present in the generated order. Any nature of instrument can be referenced. This field is mandatory.

instrDenom.description: Reference to the instrument that will be present in the generated order. Any nature of instrument can be referenced. This field is mandatory.

lastEventGenerateD.description: Provides the date of the last order generation of the occurrence by the Event Generation function.

minInvestAmtM.description:
The minimum amount to be invested for the current instruction in the context of a financial planning.

If the calculated amount to invest is greater than or equal to this minimum amount to invest, the system creates an operation using the calculated amount to invest.

name.description: Provides the name of the standing instruction; the name might not necessarily be unique. This field is optional.

opAmountCurrencyCode.description:
Specifies the currency of the amount of this occurrence.

IMPORTANT: this currency will also be the Operation Currency of the generated order.

This field is mandatory.

opAmountM.description: Indicates the maximum amount of the generated orders. This field is mandatory.

opNatE.description: Reference to the nature of operation that will be present in the generated order. This field is mandatory.

orderFeeAmtM.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee amount when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 1 (In Amount).

This amount must be used in conjunction with the fee amount currency (order_fee_curr_id).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeCurrCode.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the currency of the negotiated fee amount when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 1 (In Amount).

This currency must be used in conjunction with the fee amount (order_fee_amt_m).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeE.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee set-up.

The set-up can be either 0 (Not negotiated), 1 (Negotiated in amount) or 2 (Negotiated in percent).

When the set-up is 1 (Negotiated in amount), then the fields order fee amount (order_fee_amt_m) and currency (order_fee_curr_id) must be defined.

When the set-up is 2 (Negotiated in percent), then the field order fee percent(order_fee_p) must be defined.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

orderFeeP.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the negotiated fee percent when the fee set-up (order_fee_e) is defined as 2 (In Percent).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan fee set-up management.

portfolioCode.description: Reference to the portfolio of the standing instruction.

statusE.description:
Provides the status of the standing instruction and distinguishes between the various stages of the processing of a standing instruction. This field is mandatory.

Business functions take into account only standing instructions from a special stage.
This stage is defined by system parameter STANDING_INSTRUCTION_STAT_EXEC.

weightP.description: Provides the weight of the standing instruction.

counterpartAccountC.description: Account where the free deposit must be transferred to. This attribute is not a link to the instrument entity in order to support account not present in FOPM but available in the back-office.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

planDefinitionCode.description: Definition of plan related to the deposit.

transferFromAcctCode.description: Cash account that is debited for the deposit.

transferFromPortfolioCode.description: Portfolio of the cash account that is debited for the deposit.

updAmtToCashE.description: Amount that can be updated depending on the available cash in the linked account.

dataSecuProfId.description: Provides a reference to the security profile to which the occurrence belongs. This mandatory reference controls user access to the occurrence.

denom.description: Provides the denomination of the Plan Definition.

name.description: Provides the name of the Plan Definition.

natureE.description: Provides the nature of the Plan Definition.

objectiveNatureE.description: Provides the nature of the objective of the plan.

portfolioCode.description: Identifies the portfolio that is linked to the Plan Definition. A portfolio can have only one valid plan at a time.

statusE.description: Provides the status of the Plan Definition.

thirdPartyCode.description: Identifies the client for which the financial plan is created.

validationD.description: Provides the date of validation for the Plan Definition.

creationD.description: Provides the creation date of the record.

eventCode.description:
Indicates the reference of the standing instruction related to a financial plan investment.

Once the event generation function is run on a financial plan, it creates the necessary plan investment dates, corresponding to the different investments to do based on the characteristics of the plan and its standing instruction. Each of these plan investment date will have its event code set as the standing instruction used to generate the orders.

Note that should the Mutual Fund Systematic plan have more than one standing instruction, the first one is used to set the event code.

eventNumberN.description:
Indicates the date related to a financial plan investment.

Once the event generation function is run on a financial plan, it creates the necessary plan investment dates, corresponding to the different investments to do based on the characteristics of the plan and its standing instruction. Each of these plan investment date will have its event number set as investment plan date, with the format YYYYMMDD, for example 20190201 a for a plan investment date on February 1st 2019.

investmentD.description: Provides the date of the investment.

planInvestParamHistoId.description: Identifies the Plan Investment Parameter History related to the plan investment date.

retryN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the retry number related to a plan investment.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed. 

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

statusE.description: Provides the status of the investment.

beginD.description: Provides the begin date of the plan investment parameter.

counterpartAccountC.description: Account where the recurrent deposit must be transferred from. This attribute is not a link to the instrument entity in order to support accounts not present in FOPM but available in the back-office.

creationD.description: Provides the creation date of the plan investment parameter.

endOfMonthConvE.description: Provides the ability to manage the real last day of the month (i.e., 30th or 31st depending on the month).

firstInvestD.description: Provides the first investment date defined for the financial plan.

genCashOpF.description: Manages the ability to specify whether the cash transfer operation from the debited account has to be created.

investAcctCode.description: Identifies the account where the cash is reserved and the one where the security investment will be settled.

investFreqN.description: Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan investment parameter that are used to specify the date of investment.

investFreqUnitE.description: Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan investment parameter that are used to specify the date of investment.

investmentDayE.description: Provides the day in a month on which the investment is done.

lastInvestmentD.description: Provides the last investment date defined for the financial plan. This date is set by default value and used only for information purposes, no processes are linked to this date.

maxInvestAmtM.description: Provides the maximum amount to invest. It manages the ability to cap the amount to invest mainly when, for instance, there are missing payments or the objective amount has been updated.

maxRetryN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the maximum number of order retries before an order cycle is skipped.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

nextInvestD.description: Provides the next investment date calculated for the financial plan.

orderCyclesN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the number of cycles required for the plan. This number is then used to calculate, by default value, the plan end date.

Lets take the following example: a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan starts on February 14th 2018, with a monthly frequency, investing every 20th of each month.

The first investment date will be defaulted as February 20th 2018.

Should the user enters the number of cycles as 12 (meaning investing for 12 months), the end date will be defaulted as January 20th 2019.

The 12 investment dates would be:
1 - 20.02.2018
2 - 20.03.2018
3 - 20.04.2018
4 - 20.05.2018
5 - 20.06.2018
6 - 20.07.2018
7 - 20.08.2018
8 - 20.09.2018
9 - 20.10.2018
10 - 20.11.2018
11 - 20.12.2018
12 - 20.01.2019

planDefinitionCode.description: Identifies the plan definition related to the plan investment parameter.

retryFrequencyN.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the frequency number for each order retry.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

The retry frequency number must be used in conjunction with the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e).

For example, should you want to set up a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry of failed orders each 2 days, the frequency number (retry_frequency_n) must set to 2, and the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e) to 1 (day).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

retryFrequencyUnitE.description:
For Mutual Fund Systematic Plans, it indicates the frequency unit for each order retry.

An order retry is a new order creation from the event generation function once a plan investment order has failed.

The retry frequency unit must be used in conjunction with the retry frequency number (retry_frequency_n).

For example, should you want to set up a Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry of failed orders each 2 days, the frequency number (retry_frequency_n) must set to 2, and the retry frequency unit (retry_frequency_unit_e) to 1 (day).

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about Mutual Fund Systematic Plan retry mechanism.

standingOrderExternalRef.description:
Provides the external reference to the standing order.
This attribute is used to track the standing order saved in the external tool that manages all the cash transfers.

transferFromAcctCode.description: Identifies the cash account that is debited for the investment.

transferFromPortfolioCode.description: Identifies the portfolio of the cash account that is debited for the investment.

updAmtToCashE.description: Provides the amount that can be updated depending on the available cash in the linked account.

updAmtToObjectiveE.description:
Provides the amount of the investment that can be updated to reach the minimum or the maximum amount defined at the plan objective level or the plan rule level.

For plan with objective nature set to "Free Amount", "Period Amount", or "Objective Amount", Update Amount to Objective should be set to No.

For plan with objective nature set to  "Invest Amount",  Update Amount to Objective should be set to No or Reach min.

amountNatureE.description: Provides the nature of the amounts defined for the plan objective.

beginD.description: Provides the begin date of the plan objective.

creationD.description: Provides the creation date of the plan objective.

currencyCode.description: Identifies the currency of the amounts of the plan objective.

expectedAmountM.description: Provides the expected amount the user wants to achieve at the end of the plan. This amount is used only for information and is never used by the Event Generation function to compute the amount to invest.

maxAmountM.description:
Provides the maximum amount to achieve for the plan objective.

For plan with objective nature set to "Amount Objective", the maximum amount is not necessary.

maxAmtIndexRuleE.description: Provides the indexation rule of the maximum amount.

maxAmtIndexValueN.description: Provides the indexation value of the maximum amount.

minAmountM.description:
Provides the minimum amount to achieve for the plan objective.

For plan with objective nature set to "Invest Amount", the minimum amount is mandatory and must be defined  either in the plan objective or in the plan rule.

For plan with objective nature set to "Free Amount", the maximum amount is not necessary.

minAmtIndexRuleE.description: Provides the indexation rule of the minimum amount.

minAmtIndexValueN.description: Provides the indexation value of the minimum amount.

objectiveD.description: Provides the end date of the plan objective.

periodFreqN.description: Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan objective that are used to specify the time-lapse to achieve the goal.

periodFreqUnitE.description:
Provides the period frequency unit (e.g., monthly, yearly) and the period frequency number of the plan objective that are used to specify the time-lapse to achieve the goal.

For plan with objective nature set to "Period Amount", the period frequency is mandatory and must be defined either in the plan objective or in the plan rule.

For plan with objective nature set to "Invest Amount" or "Free Amount", the period frequency is not necessary.

planDefinitionCode.description: Identifies the plan definition related to the plan objective.

calcFromD.description:
Specifies the starting date in financial functions that return financial data calculated between two dates (Journal, Operation History, Performance and Return).
For single date functions (Valuation, Strategy Check) enter the date for which you want the function to run.
Valuation function does not retrieve prices in the future even if the entered date is greater than the current date.

calcTillD.description: The date used as the end date in financial functions that return financial data calculated between two dates. The financial functions in question are Journal, Operation History, Performance and Return.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity. 

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

planDefinitionCode.description:
Indicates the plan to use in conjunction with the Generation Nature "Create Session & Check" (event_gen_nat_e = 10 - Create Session & Check).

This allows launching an event generation function in a simulation mode with a working Mutual Fund Systematic plan definition set as parameter. The goal is to simulate the generation of the first order cycle of a specific plan, and only for this plan.

The result of the event generation simulation mode, meaning a set of buy orders, are included in a session on which a PTCC is run, with potential cases raised.

Please refer to the Front Office Business Functions user guide (chapter on Event Generation) for more details about plan simulation.

Note that the plan definition field is not displayed in the default domain GUI screen; the reason being that it is currently only used in the WealthSuite Channels for Mutual Fund Systematic Plan module.

portfolioCode.description:
This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

Portfolio set in the domain context when the portfolio dimension is a single portfolio.

beginD.description:
Provides the begin date of a standing instruction. This date is part of the standing instruction primary key.

This information is combined with the 'end date' to define the validity period of the standing instruction. It also defines the date of the future generated orders:
- The first generated order will be on exactly this date.
- The date of the following orders will be calculated from this date.

Examples:
begin date = "15/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Day" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 15/04/2009, 16/04/2009, 17/04/2009, ....

begin date = "15/01/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 3
=> dates of generation, 15/01/2009, 15/04/2009, 15/07/2009, ....

begin date = "30/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 30/04/2009, 31/05/2009, 30/06/2009, ....
In this case, a begin date equal to an end of month associated with a frequency unit "Month" leads only to dates equal at end of month.

code.description: Provides the unique business identifier of the Standing Instruction and is displayed to the end user. This field is mandatory.

commentC.description: Optional text field that can store user comments.

dayFriF.description:
Specifies whether "Friday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayMonF.description:
Specifies whether "Monday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

daySatF.description:
Specifies whether "Saturday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

daySunF.description:
Specifies whether "Sunday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayThuF.description:
Specifies whether "Thursday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayTueF.description:
Specifies whether "Tuesday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

dayWedF.description:
Specifies whether "Wednesday" is the day when the order is generated.

This flag is only used with frequency unit "Week".

denom.description: Provides the denomination of the standing instruction; the denomination might not necessarily be unique. This field is optional.

endD.description:
Provides the end date of a standing instruction. This parameter is optional.

This information is combined with the 'begin date' to define the validity period of the standing instruction. No end date provided means no end to the standing instruction.

executionDayN.description:
Specifies the day of the month when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Specific Day".

executionMonthN.description:
Specifies the month when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency unit "Year".

executionUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit of execution for calculating the date when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Calculated Day".

executionUnitRankE.description:
Specifies the rank of unit execution for calculating the date when the order is generated.

Only used with frequency units "Month" and "Year" with a frequency choice "Calculated Day".

freqN.description:
Specifies the frequency with which the order is generated and defines the number of standing instruction frequency units (see attribute freq_unit_e ) between two occurrences.
This is a mandatory field.

Examples:
begin date = "15/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Day" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 15/04/2009, 16/04/2009, 17/04/2009, ....

begin date = "15/01/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 3
=> dates of generation, 15/01/2009, 15/04/2009, 15/07/2009, ....

begin date = "30/04/2009" with a frequency unit = "Month" and frequency = 1
=> dates of generation, 30/04/2009, 31/05/2009, 30/06/2009, ....
In this case, a begin date equal to an end of month associated with a frequency unit "Month" leads only to dates equal at end of month.

freqUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit that defines the frequency with which the order is generated. This field is mandatory.

Only the following frequencies are supported:
- Day
- Month
- Year

frequencyChoiceE.description:
Defines the frequency choice.

This choice depends on the frequency unit:

For unit "Days"
- 1 = every days
- 2 = every weekday

For unit "Month"
- 1 = specific day
- 2 = calculated day

For unit "Year"
- 1 = specific day
- 2 = calculated day
